wikipedia_page.main: David Peter Lafayette Hunter MC (24 November 1919 – 5 September 2001) was a Royal Marines officer who was prisoner of war captive in Colditz Castle during the Second World War. He later served as the commanding officer of 40 Commando, and was a recipient of the Military Cross.

response: * David Peter Lafayette Hunter (1919–2001), British Royal Marines Officer
*David Peter Lafayette Hunter, 81, British Royal Marines officer.
